person.note: Zhang(2) Dun [333] Yuanyou coalition. His father, Yu [3191], moved to Suzhou to establish this family (qijia), which was the beginning of the southern lineage (zu) of the Wuxian Zhang(2). However, Dun's elder brother , Xin [12963], and sons, Yuan [12969] and Chi [7148] and grandson Jie [334] remained in, or returned to, Jianning Pucheng county. Yu died at age 89. For notice that Dun studied with Shao(2) Yong [3718], see documentation for Shao(2) Bowen [20864]. Chi's [7148] father, Jin(2)'s [335] grandfather, Zhang(1) Xun(2)'s [233] father-in-law. Collateral kin of Zhang(2) Dexiang [344]. Li(2) Di's [1096] grandnephew, Li(2) Xiaoshou's [3503] and Lin(1) Yan's [1174] patron. His great grandson was dismissed as Jinbu langzhong in 1182. Dun was opposed by Li(2) Shen [1073] and supported by Yang(2) Wei(2) [2032] during the Shaosheng period. He was also opposed by Chao(2) Duanyan [14] (qv.). XCB, 225.2a, 21a, 236.2b, 237.3b, 245.3a, 252.21b, 255.7b, 8b, 256.13b, 14a, 269.14b, 15a; SHY:ZG, 72.7b; SS, 471.13b; DDSL, 95.3b; Du Dagui, 'xia,' 18.4b-5a; YLDD, 12506.4b. Fujian TZ, 147.21a, which still has him as a Pucheng resident, also identifies Dun as the younger brother of Xin, whose son Heng [12964] was jinshi #1 in 1057. Xin is therefore an uncle, which matches up neatly with Fang [3184], son of Pin [342] and father of Jie(3) [345]. CBD, 3, 2076-7.
